info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 3:23PM CDT until June 02 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN PECOS AND NORTH CENTRAL TERRELL COUNTIES... At 322 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 29 miles south of McCamey, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Tennis ball sized hail and tornado has been reported by emergency managers on this storm. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bakersfield. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 292 and 300. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southwestern Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
